newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy opposition plans May 3 rally against budget.
newsitem.headline: Italy opposition plans May 3 rally against budget.

text.p: Italy's opposition centre-right Freedom Alliance will hold a rally next month against the government's proposed mini-budget, the leader of one of the coalition's parties told reporters on Thursday.

"The Freedom Alliance will hold a national rally in Milan on May 3...to say a resounding no to the (governing) majority's proposals," Clemente Mastella, head of the small centrist CCD party, told reporters after a meeting of the bloc's leaders.

Prime Minister Romano Prodi's centre-left government last week unveiled a controversial mini-budget designed to plug a hole in state accounts and ensure that Italy is a founder member of the European single currency at its 1999 launch.

The package, designed to raise 15.5 trillion lire ($9.3 billion) in 1997, was condemned by Freedom Alliance leader Silvio Berlusconi as a "sham that has no effect on the mechanisms of public spending".
One of the most contested measures in the mini-budget, which has to be approved by parliament, is a requirement for firms to pay taxes on huge severance payment funds two years early. ($1=1,655 lire)
